summary: Library that makes vim able to safely load JSON files
name: jsonvim
description:
This plugin provides the ability to load JSON encoded data from files and dump 
Vim variables to files. Data loaded is cached in order to speed up the 
plugin.

This plugin also provides Russian documentation. Add «ru» to option «helplang» in order to use it.

Documentation: http://vimpluginloader.sourceforge.net/doc/json.txt.html
Russian documentation: http://vimpluginloader.sourceforge.net/doc/json.rux.html
Project page: http://sourceforge.net/projects/jsonvim
Dependencies (you do not need to install them by yourself, see installation details):
vimscript #3184, http://sourceforge.net/projects/vimpluginloader
vimscript #3186, http://sourceforge.net/projects/vimstuff
install_details:
You can install this plugin using scriptmanager (vimscript #2905) plugin (install scriptmanager, run ``ActivateAddons vimpluginloader'' and add ``call vam#ActivateAddons(["vimpluginloader"])'' to your .vimrc. Vim-addon-manager will install all dependencies for you). You can also use archives attached to this page, they contain plugin with all dependencies, so you do not need to fetch them yourself.

Gentoo users can use the following mercurial overlay: http://vimpluginloader.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/vimpluginloader/pluginloader-overlay.

It is recommended to use vim with python support and install demjson python package: this will speed up this plugin.

versions.release_notes: Reposting bundle due to core plugins update
Reposting bundle due to core plugins update
Minor fix: removed escaping of `[' inside a collection
Made plugin support other Python JSON implementations, including standart json
